components.description: The edible fungus of the mushroom, depicted as a toadstool with a white-spotted red cap and stem.
components.title: Mushroom

description: The edible fungus of the mushroom, depicted as a toadstool with a white-spotted red cap and stem.
title: Mushroom

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Plant symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A mushroom emoji; a vegetable that looks similar to a toadstool. Mushroom was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 http://emojipedia.org/mushroom/
emoji_net_data.name: mushroom

bn:00108743a: Having the qualities or effects of a poison
Containing sufficient poison to be dangerous.
Containing sufficient poison to be dangerous

bn:00103430a: Of or pertaining to a fungus or fungi.
Of or pertaining to a fungus.

bn:00079663n: In culinary terms, a vegetable is an edible plant or its part, intended for cooking or eating raw.
A plant raised for some edible part of it.
Edible seeds or roots or stems or leaves or bulbs or tubers or nonsweet fruits of any of numerous herbaceous plant
Edible plant or part of a plant
A nutritional and culinary term that denotes any part of a plant that is commonly consumed by humans as food.
Any of various herbaceous plants having parts that are used as food.
The edible part of such a plant.
